subject: Math
title: Expanding Quadratic Expressions
description: Learn to expand factored forms into standard form

content.text: Sometimes quadratics are given in factored form like (x + 2)(x - 3). We need to expand them to get standard form using the distributive property (FOIL).

content.heading: FOIL Method
content.text:
When multiplying (a + b)(c + d):
• First: multiply first terms (ac)
• Outer: multiply outer terms (ad)
• Inner: multiply inner terms (bc)
• Last: multiply last terms (bd)
Result: ac + ad + bc + bd

content.heading: Practice Problems
problems: Expand (x + 2)(x + 3). What is the constant term?
Expand (x - 1)(x + 4). What is the coefficient of x?
Expand (x + 5)(x + 1). What is the constant term?
Expand (x - 3)(x - 2). What is the constant term?
Expand (x + 4)(x - 4). What is the x² coefficient?
Expand (x - 5)(x + 5). What is the constant term?
Expand (x + 6)(x + 2). What is the coefficient of x?
Expand (x - 7)(x + 3). What is the coefficient of x?
Expand (x + 1)(x + 1). What is the constant term?
Expand (x - 2)(x + 8). What is the constant term?
